verses.kjv: We then that are strong ought to bear the infirmities of the weak, and not to please ourselves.
verses.ct: Those of us who are strong in faith should carry the burdens of those who are weaker, rather than just doing what makes us comfortable.

verses.kjv: Let every one of us please his neighbour for his good to edification.
verses.ct: Each of us should aim to do what benefits our neighbor and builds them up.

verses.kjv: For even Christ pleased not himself; but, as it is written, The reproaches of them that reproached thee fell on me.
verses.ct: After all, Christ didn't live to satisfy himself. Instead, as Scripture says, 'The insults directed at you landed on me.'

verses.kjv: For whatsoever things were written aforetime were written for our learning, that we through patience and comfort of the scriptures might have hope.
verses.ct: Everything that was recorded in Scripture long ago was written to teach us, so that through endurance and the encouragement that the Scriptures provide, we could hold on to hope.

verses.kjv: Now the God of patience and consolation grant you to be likeminded one toward another according to Christ Jesus:
verses.ct: May God, who gives endurance and encouragement, help you live in harmony with each other as you follow Christ Jesus,

verses.kjv: That ye may with one mind and one mouth glorify God, even the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.
verses.ct: so that together, with one heart and one voice, you can bring glory to God, the Father of our Lord Jesus Christ.

verses.kjv: Wherefore receive ye one another, as Christ also received us to the glory of God.
verses.ct: So accept one another, just as Christ accepted us, for the glory of God.

verses.kjv: Now I say that Jesus Christ was a minister of the circumcision for the truth of God, to confirm the promises made unto the fathers:
verses.ct: What I'm saying is that Christ became a servant to the Jewish people to demonstrate God's faithfulness, confirming the promises given to their ancestors.

verses.kjv: And that the Gentiles might glorify God for his mercy; as it is written, For this cause I will confess to thee among the Gentiles, and sing unto thy name.
verses.ct: He also came so that the Gentiles would glorify God for his mercy. As Scripture says, 'That is why I will praise you among the Gentiles and sing to your name.'

verses.kjv: And again he saith, Rejoice, ye Gentiles, with his people.
verses.ct: It also says, 'Celebrate, you Gentiles, along with his people.'

verses.kjv: And again, Praise the Lord, all ye Gentiles; and laud him, all ye people.
verses.ct: And again, 'Praise the Lord, all you Gentiles; let all the peoples praise him.'

verses.kjv: And again, Esaias saith, There shall be a root of Jesse, and he that shall rise to reign over the Gentiles; in him shall the Gentiles trust.
verses.ct: Isaiah also wrote, 'A descendant of Jesse will appear — one who rises up to rule over the Gentiles. The Gentiles will place their hope in him.'

verses.kjv: Now the God of hope fill you with all joy and peace in believing, that ye may abound in hope, through the power of the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: May the God of hope fill you with complete joy and peace as you trust in him, so that you overflow with hope through the power of the Holy Spirit.

verses.kjv: And I myself also am persuaded of you, my brethren, that ye also are full of goodness, filled with all knowledge, able also to admonish one another.
verses.ct: I'm personally convinced about you, my brothers and sisters, that you are full of goodness, equipped with thorough knowledge, and perfectly capable of instructing each other.

verses.kjv: Nevertheless, brethren, I have written the more boldly unto you in some sort, as putting you in mind, because of the grace that is given to me of God,
verses.ct: Still, brothers and sisters, I've written to you quite boldly on some points as a reminder, because of the grace God gave me

verses.kjv: That I should be the minister of Jesus Christ to the Gentiles, ministering the gospel of God, that the offering up of the Gentiles might be acceptable, being sanctified by the Holy Ghost.
verses.ct: to be a servant of Christ Jesus to the Gentiles. I serve as a priest of God's good news, so that the Gentiles might become an offering acceptable to God, made holy by the Holy Spirit.

verses.kjv: I have therefore whereof I may glory through Jesus Christ in those things which pertain to God.
verses.ct: Therefore, through Christ Jesus, I have reason to take pride in my work for God.

verses.kjv: For I will not dare to speak of any of those things which Christ hath not wrought by me, to make the Gentiles obedient, by word and deed,
verses.ct: I wouldn't dare talk about anything except what Christ has accomplished through me to bring the Gentiles to obedience — through what I've said and done,

verses.kjv: Through mighty signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God; so that from Jerusalem, and round about unto Illyricum, I have fully preached the gospel of Christ.
verses.ct: through the power of miraculous signs and wonders, and through the power of the Spirit of God. From Jerusalem all the way around to Illyricum, I have thoroughly proclaimed the good news of Christ.

verses.kjv: Yea, so have I strived to preach the gospel, not where Christ was named, lest I should build upon another man’s foundation:
verses.ct: My ambition has always been to share the good news where Christ was not yet known, so I wouldn't be building on someone else's foundation.

verses.kjv: But as it is written, To whom he was not spoken of, they shall see: and they that have not heard shall understand.
verses.ct: As Scripture says, 'Those who were never told about him will see, and those who never heard will understand.'

verses.kjv: For which cause also I have been much hindered from coming to you.
verses.ct: This is exactly why I've been prevented so many times from visiting you.

verses.kjv: But now having no more place in these parts, and having a great desire these many years to come unto you;
verses.ct: But now, since there's no more room for my work in these regions, and since I've been longing for many years to visit you,

verses.kjv: Whensoever I take my journey into Spain, I will come to you: for I trust to see you in my journey, and to be brought on my way thitherward by you, if first I be somewhat filled with your company.
verses.ct: I plan to see you on my way to Spain. I hope to spend some time enjoying your company and then have you send me on my way there.

verses.kjv: But now I go unto Jerusalem to minister unto the saints.
verses.ct: Right now, though, I'm traveling to Jerusalem to serve the believers there.

verses.kjv: For it hath pleased them of Macedonia and Achaia to make a certain contribution for the poor saints which are at Jerusalem.
verses.ct: The churches in Macedonia and Achaia were happy to collect a financial gift for the believers in Jerusalem who are in need.

verses.kjv: It hath pleased them verily; and their debtors they are. For if the Gentiles have been made partakers of their spiritual things, their duty is also to minister unto them in carnal things.
verses.ct: They were glad to do it, and really, they owe it to them. Since the Gentiles have shared in the Jewish believers' spiritual blessings, they ought to support them with material resources in return.

verses.kjv: When therefore I have performed this, and have sealed to them this fruit, I will come by you into Spain.
verses.ct: Once I've completed this task and made sure they've received this gift, I'll head to Spain by way of your city.

verses.kjv: And I am sure that, when I come unto you, I shall come in the fulness of the blessing of the gospel of Christ.
verses.ct: I'm confident that when I arrive, I'll come with the full blessing of Christ's good news.

verses.kjv: Now I beseech you, brethren, for the Lord Jesus Christ’s sake, and for the love of the Spirit, that ye strive together with me in your prayers to God for me;
verses.ct: I urge you, brothers and sisters, by our Lord Jesus Christ and by the love that the Spirit produces, to join me in my struggle by praying to God on my behalf.

verses.kjv: That I may be delivered from them that do not believe in Judaea; and that my service which I have for Jerusalem may be accepted of the saints;
verses.ct: Pray that I'll be rescued from the unbelievers in Judea, and that my service in Jerusalem will be welcomed by the believers there.

verses.kjv: That I may come unto you with joy by the will of God, and may with you be refreshed.
verses.ct: Then, if it's God's will, I can come to you with joy and find rest in your company.

verses.kjv: Now the God of peace be with you all. Amen.
verses.ct: May the God of peace be with all of you. Amen.
